intro: Fumaria muraslis var. laeta, commonly known as the Happy Yellow Celandine, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to garden ecosystems.
